summary.para: The code that identifies the type of debugging event. This member can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: Reports a create-process debugging event (includes both a process and its main thread). The value of u.CreateProcessInfo specifies a structure.
Reports a create-thread debugging event (does not include the main thread of a process, see `CREATE_PROCESS_DEBUG_EVENT`). The value of u.CreateThread specifies a structure.
Reports an exception debugging event. The value of u.Exception specifies an structure.
Reports an exit-process debugging event. The value of u.ExitProcess specifies an structure.
Reports an exit-thread debugging event. The value of u.ExitThread specifies an structure.
Reports a load-dynamic-link-library (DLL) debugging event. The value of u.LoadDll specifies a structure.
Reports an output-debugging-string debugging event. The value of u.DebugString specifies an structure.
Reports a RIP-debugging event (system debugging error). The value of u.RipInfo specifies a structure.
Reports an unload-DLL debugging event. The value of u.UnloadDll specifies an structure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.dwProcessId
member.summary: The identifier of the process in which the debugging event occurred. A debugger uses this value to locate the debugger's per-process structure. These values are not necessarily small integers that can be used as table indices.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.dwThreadId
member.summary: The identifier of the thread in which the debugging event occurred. A debugger uses this value to locate the debugger's per-thread structure. These values are not necessarily small integers that can be used as table indices.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u
member.summary: Any additional information relating to the debugging event. This union takes on the type and value appropriate to the type of debugging event, as described in the dwDebugEventCodemember.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.Exception
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is EXCEPTION_DEBUG_EVENT (1),u.Exception specifies an structure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.CreateThread
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is CREATE_THREAD_DEBUG_EVENT(2), u.CreateThread specifies anstructure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.CreateProcessInfo
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is CREATE_PROCESS_DEBUG_EVENT(3), u.CreateProcessInfo specifies anstructure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.ExitThread
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is EXIT_THREAD_DEBUG_EVENT(4), u.ExitThread specifies an structure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.ExitProcess
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is EXIT_PROCESS_DEBUG_EVENT(5), u.ExitProcess specifies an structure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.LoadDll
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is LOAD_DLL_DEBUG_EVENT (6),u.LoadDll specifies an structure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.UnloadDll
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is UNLOAD_DLL_DEBUG_EVENT(7), u.UnloadDll specifies an structure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.DebugString
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING_EVENT(8), u.DebugString specifies anstructure.

member.name: DEBUG_EVENT.u.RipInfo
member.summary: Type: If the dwDebugEventCode is RIP_EVENT (9),u.RipInfo specifies an structure.
